channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump wants to lower the cost of IVF. New executive order seeks ideas to do that
item.description: President Trump campaigned on lowering the cost of IVF, after a controversial ruling made the treatment stop in Alabama for a short time
item.content:encoded:
President Trump campaigned on lowering the cost of IVF, after a controversial ruling made the treatment stop in Alabama for a short time

(Image credit: Sebastian Kaulitzki)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: National Science Foundation fires roughly 10% of its workforce
item.description: NSF fired 168 employees, leaving the agency less equipped to fund a wide range of scientific research.
item.content:encoded:
NSF fired 168 employees, leaving the agency less equipped to fund a wide range of scientific research.

(Image credit: Narumon Bowonkitwanchai/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: It's Frankie Muniz's world with both a NASCAR career and sitcom reboot in the works
item.description: For Frankie Muniz, balancing a career as a professional NASCAR driver and a TV actor isn't a fantasy; it'll be his very busy reality this upcoming year.
item.content:encoded:
For Frankie Muniz, balancing a career as a professional NASCAR driver and a TV actor isn't a fantasy; it'll be his very busy reality this upcoming year.

(Image credit: Mike Ehrmann)
item.dc:creator: Manuela LÃ³pez Restrepo

item.title: Artists protest new NEA restrictions
item.description: Hundreds of artists signed a letter sent to the National Endowment for the Arts asking it to reverse policy changes made as a result of recent executive orders issued by President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Hundreds of artists signed a letter sent to the National Endowment for the Arts asking it to reverse policy changes made as a result of recent executive orders issued by President Trump.

(Image credit: Graeme Sloan)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Pope Francis has pneumonia in both lungs, Vatican says
item.description: Pope Francis has pneumonia in both lungs, according to the Vatican. There's concern about the ability of the 88-year-old pontiff to fight off the infection.
item.content:encoded:
Pope Francis has pneumonia in both lungs, according to the Vatican. There's concern about the ability of the 88-year-old pontiff to fight off the infection.

(Image credit: Antonio Masiello)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Ventre

item.title: Ireland Weighs a Boycott
item.description: Ireland considers becoming the first western country to ban trade with Israeli settlements in the Occupied Palestinian Territories. The move is controversial, but Ireland has a history of leading the way with effective boycotts. We hear about the past and present of Irish activism.
item.content:encoded: Ireland considers becoming the first western country to ban trade with Israeli settlements in the Occupied Palestinian Territories. The move is controversial, but Ireland has a history of leading the way with effective boycotts. We hear about the past and present of Irish activism.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: What we know about the Toronto plane crash
item.description: Investigators have removed the flight data recorder from a Delta Air Lines regional jet that flipped upside down and burst into flames upon landing at Toronto Pearson International Airport on Monday.
item.content:encoded:
Investigators have removed the flight data recorder from a Delta Air Lines regional jet that flipped upside down and burst into flames upon landing at Toronto Pearson International Airport on Monday.

(Image credit: Geoff Robins)
item.dc:creator: James Doubek

item.title: A pediatrician warns of 'long-lasting' consequences of RFK Jr. leading HHS
item.description: Adam Ratner predicts the appointment of anti-vaccine activist Robert F. Kennedy Jr. will impact vaccine availability and hesitancy: "It is much easier to scare people than to unscare them," he says.
item.content:encoded:
Adam Ratner predicts the appointment of anti-vaccine activist Robert F. Kennedy Jr. will impact vaccine availability and hesitancy: "It is much easier to scare people than to unscare them," he says.

(Image credit: Joseph Prezioso)
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: Privacy advocates file lawsuit to stop DOGE from peeking at IRS taxpayer data
item.description: A coalition of watchdog groups and unions is seeking to block the DOGE team from accessing taxpayer data at the IRS. A similar battle is brewing over Social Security data.
item.content:encoded:
A coalition of watchdog groups and unions is seeking to block the DOGE team from accessing taxpayer data at the IRS. A similar battle is brewing over Social Security data.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Why did the baby seal cross the road? It's not a riddle for this Connecticut city
item.description: A baby seal was rescued from the streets of downtown New Haven, lethargic and underweight. He is now recovering at a nearby aquarium, which hopes to eventually release him back into the ocean.
item.content:encoded: A baby seal was rescued from the streets of downtown New Haven, lethargic and underweight. He is now recovering at a nearby aquarium, which hopes to eventually release him back into the ocean.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman
